citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, an 8x16 inch flooded enclosure contained 2 adult and 14 dead baby hamsters floating in
approximately one inch of water, as well as 2 surviving adults and one baby that were hunched or huddled together. The
surviving animals appeared uncomfortable and distressed by the wet conditions. The leakage of the automatic waterer
resulted in a primary enclosure that was harmful to the animals, and resulted in the deaths as well the discomfort of the
remaining animals in the enclosure. Licensee must ensure that all hamsters shall be transferred to clean primary
enclosures in order to ensure the health and welfare of the animals.
Corrected at the time of inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
